Module.name: util
Module.Function: Indicates whether the alt key is pressed.

Bind a regular function to an object as one of its methods. The object to which the function is to be bound. A function to be bound to the object. The attribute name to use for the method; if not specified, the function’s __name__ attribute will be used.
Indicates whether the control key is pressed.

Function.name: hsvaColor(h, s, v, a) → pygame.Color
Function.span: Creates a Color instance from the data provided.

Module.Function: Indicates whether any of the shift, control, or alt keys is pressed.

Function.name: randColor(alpha) → pygame.Color
Function.Arg: Specify whether to include a random alpha value as part of the color.

Module.Function: Randomly chooses a pixel from the specified object and returns the coordinates as a 2-tuple. A Sketch or Image instance, or other object that has a comparable size property.

Function.name: rgba(*args) → pygame.Color
Function.span: Creates a Color instance from the data provided; if multiple arguments are passed, returns a list of Color instances.

Arg.name: *args
Arg.span: RGB or RGBA tuples, hex code strings, or color names.

Module.Function: Indicates whether the shift key is pressed.
Module.Constant: Specify the center as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the upper left corner as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the lower left corner as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the upper right corner as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the lower right corner as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the middle of the left side as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the middle of the right side as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the middle of the top side as the anchor point for blitting images.
Specify the middle of the bottom side as the anchor point for blitting images.

Constant.name: BOLD
Constant.span: Indicates bold type when calling PApplet.loadFont.

Constant.name: ITALIC
Constant.span: Indicates italicized type when calling PApplet.loadFont.
